EN 2005-12-23 Software Development|High Performance Computing|Grid and Web Services This article introduces the Globus Monitoring and Discovery Service (MDS). It discusses the components that make up MDS and describes how other services typically interact with MDS in a grid environment. After reading this article, you should be able to configure the Globus MDS and register services, as well as other information providers with MDS. You'll learn how to aggregate information and how to configure multiple Index Services in an MDS hierarchy to form a grid Index Service. Various Paul Dolby 0.636567866155634 http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/grid/library/gr-gt4mds/ text/html IBM Grid in Action: Monitor and Discover Grid Services in an SOA/Web Services Environment.

EN national e-science centre,nesc,e-science,esi,e-science institute,e-Science Projects,industrial projects, projects 2006-01-19 Examples from e-Social Science Projects Information on e-Science industrial Projects. Recent trends in e-science towards seamless interfacing between remote data locations and remote high performace computing clusters have not yet been widely applied in economics. This pilot project aims to measure and demonstrate the effectiveness of such a system applied to the micro-econometric analysis of the welfare of ethinic minority groups in the UK. NESC Dolby, Paul 0.6666 http://www.nesc.ac.uk/action/projects/project_action.cfm?title=249 text/html NESC e-Science Project Information: Grid-Enabled Micro-Econometric Data Analysis
EN Environmental Modelling, Grid, social sciences 2006-01-25 Examples from e-Social Science Projects The FEARLUS-G project aims to explore the application of emerging Grid technologies within the social sciences, through deployment of an existing land-use modelling tool into the Grid context. The project brings together experts in land-use modelling with computer scientists who have experience in Grid and World-Wide Web technologies. EN 2005-12-23 Data Management|Databases Explore the architectural gaps that exist between the WebSphere® Information Integrator and a data grid built using the Open Grid Services Architecture Data Access and Integration (OGSA-DAI). Then download Grid Wrapper for WebSphere Information Integrator from alphaWorks. The authors show you how to develop a grid wrapper to work with WebSphere Information Integrator to provide database federation and data transparency. Descriptions of the existing structure and of the architecture designed to fill the gaps are included. Various Paul Dolby 0.635419006964935 http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/grid/library/gr-feddata/ text/html IBM Bridging the Integration Gap, Part 1: Federating Grid Data.

EN WSRP, WebServices, Portal, Portlet 2006-01-30 Portals and Related Technology|Grid and Web Services WSRP is the SOAP standard for allowing portals to access remote portlets. The currently implemented version of this standard is 1.0, but 2.0 is now in the final drafts. This talk will give an overview of the capabilities of WSRP 1.0, what is planned for WSRP 2.0 and what features have been defered until after 2.0. It will also summarise the relationship between WSRP and the Java Portlet APIs. Dovey, Matthew Dolby, Paul -1 http://dsg.port.ac.uk/events/workshops/VRE05/talks/Matthew%20J.%20Dovey.ppt text/html University of Oxford|University of Portsmouth WSRP Overview and Future.

EN Portals, Grid, Sakai, WSRP, JSR-168 2006-01-18 Portals and Related Technology This tutorial looks at Grid portals, which are Web-based facilities that provide a personalised, single point of access to Grid resources that support the end user in one or more tasks. From this tutorial, you will learn: What is a Grid portal and what kind of roles will it play in the Grid?, first-generation Grid portals, second generation Grid portals, the features and limitations of first generation Grid portals, the features and benefits of second generation Grid portals. Allan, Rob Dolby, Paul -1 http://tyne.dl.ac.uk/ReDRESS/Portals/Introduction%20to%20Grid%20Portals.ppt text/html CCLRC Portals Tutorial.

EN 2006-01-12 Portals and Related Technology Development of Portlet Tools for Sakai Various Paul Dolby -1 http://tyne.dl.ac.uk/Sakai/Tools/index.shtml text/html Sakai VRE Demonstrator Project Development of Portlet Tools for Sakai.
EN WSRP,Sakai,WSRP4J,Portel,Portlets 2006-01-30 Portals and Related Technology|Grid and Web Services WSRP highlights the approach to integrate both business logic and user interfaces. By standardising presentation-oriented web services, WSRP makes it possible to construct web portals in "plug-and-play" mode. In this talk, the WSRP support of selected open-source portal frameworks and the development experience of producing a WSRP consumer for Sakai will be reported. We will report on WSRP support for the eXo platform, Liferay, StringBeans and uPortal. WSRP4J, which is not a portal framework but a reference implementation of the WSRP 1.0 specification and the basis of WSRP support in many portal frameworks, is also discussed. Development experience of a servlet-based Sakai WSRP consumer built on top of ProxyPortlet, a WSRP4J consumer, will then follow. Yang, Xiaobo|Dong Wang, Xiao|Allan Rob Dolby, Paul -1 http://dsg.port.ac.uk/events/workshops/VRE05/talks/Xiaobo%20Yang.ppt text/html CCLRC, University of Portsmouth Experiences with WSRP Development and Testing.

EN grid computing, distributed computing 2006-01-12 Grid and Web Services A short article by Ian Foster from Argonne National Lab & University of Chicago. It describes a three point checklist for determining whether a system is a Grid. He goes on to discuss the critical role that standards must play in defining the Grid. EN WSRP, WebServices, Portal, Portlet 2006-01-30 Portals and Related Technology|Grid and Web Services WSRP is the SOAP standard for allowing portals to access remote portlets. The currently implemented version of this standard is 1.0, but 2.0 is now in the final drafts. This talk will give an overview of the capabilities of WSRP 1.0, what is planned for WSRP 2.0 and what features have been defered until after 2.0. It will also summarise the relationship between WSRP and the Java Portlet APIs. Dovey, Matthew Dolby, Paul -1 http://dsg.port.ac.uk/events/workshops/VRE05/talks/Matthew%20J.%20Dovey.ppt text/html University of Oxford|University of Portsmouth WSRP Overview and Future.

EN 2005-12-23 Software Development|High Performance Computing|Grid and Web Services This article introduces the Globus Monitoring and Discovery Service (MDS). It discusses the components that make up MDS and describes how other services typically interact with MDS in a grid environment. After reading this article, you should be able to configure the Globus MDS and register services, as well as other information providers with MDS. You'll learn how to aggregate information and how to configure multiple Index Services in an MDS hierarchy to form a grid Index Service. Various Paul Dolby 0.636567866155634 http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/grid/library/gr-gt4mds/ text/html IBM Grid in Action: Monitor and Discover Grid Services in an SOA/Web Services Environment.
EN WSRP,Sakai,WSRP4J,Portel,Portlets 2006-01-30 Portals and Related Technology|Grid and Web Services WSRP highlights the approach to integrate both business logic and user interfaces. By standardising presentation-oriented web services, WSRP makes it possible to construct web portals in "plug-and-play" mode. In this talk, the WSRP support of selected open-source portal frameworks and the development experience of producing a WSRP consumer for Sakai will be reported. We will report on WSRP support for the eXo platform, Liferay, StringBeans and uPortal. WSRP4J, which is not a portal framework but a reference implementation of the WSRP 1.0 specification and the basis of WSRP support in many portal frameworks, is also discussed. Development experience of a servlet-based Sakai WSRP consumer built on top of ProxyPortlet, a WSRP4J consumer, will then follow. Yang, Xiaobo|Dong Wang, Xiao|Allan Rob Dolby, Paul -1 http://dsg.port.ac.uk/events/workshops/VRE05/talks/Xiaobo%20Yang.ppt text/html CCLRC, University of Portsmouth Experiences with WSRP Development and Testing.

EN Security, Grid, 2006-02-01 Introductory Material and Support|Security and Confidentiality The purpose of this document is to raise awareness within this expanded community of some of the security challenges posed by Grid computing. As the size and profile of the community grows, the security of Grids will become more important than ever before. The Grid systems in use today do not address security in the systematic way now demanded of e-Commerce systems, and it is relatively easy to make mistakes and create insecure Grids. The aim of this document is to enable new Grid infrastructure developers, and more especially those concerned with deploying, operating and using the Grid, to create more secure systems and applications. Surridge, Mike Dolby, Paul -1 http://eprints.ecs.soton.ac.uk/7286/01/RoughGuideToGridSecurityV1_1a.pdf text/html University of Southampton Rough Guide to Grid Security

Then download Grid Wrapper for WebSphere Information Integrator from alphaWorks. Descriptions of the existing structure and of the architecture designed to fill the gaps are included. EN Arts, Humanities, Data Service, digital resources, history, learning, teaching 2006-01-18 Databases AHDS History is one of the five Centres of the Arts and Humanities Data Service and collects, preserves, and promotes the use of digital resources, which result from or support historical research, learning and teaching. AHDS History Dolby, Paul 0.6666 http://ahds.ac.uk/history/index.htm text/html University of Essex AHDS History
EN Arts, Humanities, Data Service, digital resources, history, learning, teaching, collections 2006-01-18 Databases AHDS History's collection brings together over 600 separate data collections transcribed, scanned or compiled from historical sources. The studies cover a wide range of historical topics, from the seventh century to the mid-twentieth century. Although the primary focus of the collection is on the United Kingdom, it also includes a significant body of cross-national and international data collections. Examples of topics covered include: nineteenth and twentieth century statistics, manuscript census records, state finance data, demographic data, mortality data, community histories, electoral history and economic indicators. AHDS History Dolby, Paul 0.5888055359364 http://ahds.ac.uk/history/collections/index.htm text/html University of Essex AHDS History Collections

EN esds , Economic and Social Data Service , The Data Archive, Data Archive, archive, data, computer-readable data, social sciences, humanities 2006-01-18 Databases The UK Data Archive (UKDA) is a centre of expertise in data acquisition, preservation, dissemination and promotion and is curator of the largest collection of digital data in the social sciences and humanities in the UK. It is funded by the Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC), the Joint Information Systems Committee (JISC) of the Higher Education Funding Councils and the University of Essex. Founded in 1967, it now houses several thousand datasets of interest to researchers in all sectors and from many different disciplines. EN UNIX, network, diagnostics 2006-02-01 Introductory Material and Support|Network Technology This document provides a practical guide to debugging common network problems for the UNIX operating system. It covers commands such as ping, traceroute, PingRoute. It also looks at time series, locating bottlenecks, correlation of problems with routes, as well as case studies. EN NeSC, national e-science centre, Networks for non-Networkers 2 (NFNN2) 2006-01-31 Introductory Material and Support|Network Technology This webpage describes the National e-Science Centre's Networks for non-Networkers 2 (NFNN2) workshop that took place 20 - 21 June 2005. Networks for Non-Networkers 2 (NFNN2) was a one and a half day workshop for people working at the technical level in high-bandwidth dependant science. It was not aimed at network researchers or networking experts, but at people trying to use the network for science. This page contains the agenda and links to the presentations given. This report is aimed at senior managers who are responsible for the development of institutional strategies (ILT, ICT, learning and teaching) and want some understanding of the issues involved in providing network infrastructure on their campus including the financial and pedagogic imperatives. It is of interest to Principals and Deputy Principals in FE, Pro-Vice Chancellors for IT and Learning and Teaching in HE, Heads of Computing and IT, Heads of Information Services, Heads of Estates and those responsible for space management and the design of learning spaces.
